result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

miscConds.notes: Total costs to be paid during the term of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

Defendant to submit to random testing.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa M Fitzpatrick

records.addlTxt: 10:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa M Fitzpatrick in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Lisa M Fitzpatrick. Court examines defendant as to submitted plea questionnaire and waiver.  Defendant enters guilty plea as to count 1.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  State as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.

11:15 AM Defendant in person with Atty Dvoran. ADA Lindsay for State. Counsel requests another date. Court orders booking for ATN.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Further proceedings on April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*UPDATED hearing notice indicating location of hearing

10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lisa M Fitzpatrick appeared in court, Attorney Heather Dvoran for Lisa M Fitzpatrick appeared in court. Discovery has been received. Counsel indicates a motion may be filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Clerk mailed bail/bond form to defendant w/note to sign and return copy to the COC office.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container.

9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lisa M Fitzpatrick appeared by phone via Zoom conferencing, Attorney Heather Dvoran appeared in court for Lisa M Fitzpatrick. Court advises of penalties and finds probable cause. Not guilty plea entered.  Defendant to return signed bail sheet by 2/15/22.
Further proceedings scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Per the court, defendant allowed to appear via zoom. Clerk emailed meeting ID to Atty Dvoran.
Defendant's Request for Phone/Video Appearance.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
